item.title: Sketch005
item.description: Name: sketch005 Year: 2018 Description: This series uses a noise field to orient and displace triangles. When scaled correctly and time is applied, the result is a wave-like animation in real-time. The images are frames of the animation, which try to capture the lifelike movements. The technique is explored on neutral, grid-like setups as well as settings in which the triangles are attracted to, or repelled by, some part of the image.

item.title: Sketch004
item.description: Name: sketch004 Year: 2018 Description: This was originally a poster for a birthday party of friends. The image contains a collectino of mostly German words connected to the party. It was later repurposed for public display by removing any identifying information from the image.

item.title: Sketch003
item.description: Name: sketch003 Year: 2018 Description: This series started as a visualization of the CS-version of a tree. Our trees have one root at the top, a number of branches in the middle, and finally leaves on the tips of branches. Trees are generated randomly and represented using text. (Many of the outputs are useless - they grow out of the frame, grow in a loop-like fashion back down to the root, etc.

item.title: Sketch002
item.description: Name: sketch002 Year: 2018 Description: This series explores excessive post-processing of 3D models to the point of no recognition. The underlying model consists of randomly moving and rotating cubes in 3D space. The model is first projected onto a 2D plane and then repeatedly rearranged, displaced, and mirrored.

item.title: Sketch001
item.description: Name: sketch001 Year: 2018 Description: This series was created using a rule-based approach. A number of small circles are drawn in random locations of the image. These circles then grow larger until any two of them touch. Of the two, one is eliminated through random choice. The survivor continues to grow larger, whereas the eliminated restarts as a small circle in a new random location.

item.title: LineReplica
item.description: Name: lineReplica Year: 2017? Description: This series is an experiment about approximating images using geometric primitives, mostly lines. The thing about it is that the program brute-forced the approximation by adding one line every frame, selecting from ~50 lines, seeing which one got the working image closest to the original. Because of that, I could only run it on very low-resolution images, but it produces vector images. If I then scale those up again, you see interesting effects which were not present in the original.

item.title: Recursive
item.description: Name: recursive Year: 2016 Description: This series explores the concept of recursion in computer programming, applied to line art. The images were produced using only triangles, which are drawn inside each other recursively. Even though they are drawn in 2D, the images exhibit an illusion of three dimensional structures when viewed from a distance.
